raw_comment:
-I noticed that applicants with parents who have attended the school and a high income have a large advantage in getting into elite schools. I also noticed that no matter how high or low the income the legacy will always give the applicant an advantage over someone who doesn't have a relative that attended the college
-I wonder which college is the most biased towards this legacy boost and why there is a small dip right before the rise in the chart. I also wonder how the people attending the school would vary if the colleges weren't given this information
-This relates to me because I am currently a Junior in high school and will be looking into college very soon. While applying to colleges I will have this thought in my mind about how my chances of getting into schools that my parents didn't attend will be lower than the ones they did
-Headline: Ivy League or Legacy League
ace_sentences: I noticed that an applicant has a large advantage in getting into an elite school if the parents of the applicant attended the school and the applicant has a high income.
I noticed that legacy status always gives an applicant an advantage over an applicant who has no relative who attended the college.
I wonder which college is the most biased toward the legacy boost.
I wonder why there is a small dip right before the rise in the chart.
I wonder how the people who attend the school would vary if the colleges did not have this information.
I am currently a junior in high school.
I will look into college very soon.
When I apply to colleges, I will think about this issue.
I think that my chance of getting into a school that my parents did not attend will be lower than my chance of getting into a school that my parents attended.
